report.summary: Preparing API calls and UI for longer DMs (Twitter feature change in July)
report.label: None yet
report.description: Twitter gave a heads-up that they will allow DirectMessages up to 10k characters in length in July. This would mean some UI changes for sending a DM, as well as a minor API call modification when receiving DMs via REST. https://twittercommunity.com/t/removing-the-140-character-limit-from-direct-messages/41348 REST API DM read endpoints (GET direct_messages, GET direct_messages/sent and GET direct_messages/show) Send “full_text=true” as a query parameter to receive long DM text. If this parameter is not provided, you will get a truncated version of the DM. There will be no structural changes to the response returned by these endpoints. DM write endpoint (POST direct_messages/new) The “text” parameter will start accepting text longer than 140 characters. The new limit for DMs will be 10k characters. Streaming API User Streams (GET user) and Site Streams (GET site) will automatically start receiving DMs that have text longer than 140 characters. Unlike the REST API, no additional parameter is needed. There will be no structural changes to the objects returned by these endpoints.

Selecting "favorite" or "delete" gives the error Error 144: No status found with that ID. I expected that the tweet that I deleted would be removed. Thanks!

report.summary: F-droid seems to have a version number problem

report.description: https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/issues/384 says that the version number on the nightlies is not incrementing, so F-Droid cannot host the newer versions. I'm not sure if this is intentional, given that some of the recent releases are bug-fixes.

report.summary: New tweet account selector usability issues
report.label: None yet
report.description: This is release 2015-11-22. If you have more than 3 accounts, the list is cropped by the new tweet window and has to be scrolled around to see more than just the 3 accounts that more or less fit in there. It might be a good idea to make the account list pop up above the new tweet window, seeing as how it cannot be dismissed by tapping "outside" of the list anyway. The list is kinda hard to see, especially when the base GUI is set to dark transparent. It might be better if the list comes up in a "window" in its own right.

report.summary: New tweet window too easy to dismiss
report.label: None yet
report.description: This is release 2015-11-22 Due to the new tweet window being smaller than the screen and the tap event outside of it being handled, it is too easy to accidentally close the new tweet (and trigger the draft save event). I think it is enough that the window can be dismissed with the Back button.

report.summary: Timeline doesn't appear for GNUSocial in 3.1.12
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, I have searched a lot in the web before thinking this is an issue so, sorry if this problem have been addressed or I'm doing something wrong. I've used Twidere with a Twitter account, never had a problem. Today I tried setting up GNUSocial accounts and I can't get the timeline displayed, any tweet. I've used two different accounts in two different nodes: quitter.es and quitter.se, always using Basic Auth and API URL like https://domain/api/ without suffix version, in this last step, I've tried /api, and /api/ Nevertheless, I can do all of the following stuff in the Twidere client. Publish tweet Publish tweet with picture See likes Search tweets Search users View groups I've also tried doing (which didn't work): Disabling the twitter account and setting up only the GNUSocial one In the "Home" tab, selecting only the GNUSocial account instead of "all actives" Stopping the app and empty the cache Any of these steps results in the timeline being displayed. I always have the "Slide down to update" message. My device: Motorola Moto G XT1032 (first gen), rooted, with CM12.1-20151017-NIGHTLY (Android 5.1.1)

report.summary: Can't open links in email notifications
report.label: None yet
report.description: Bear with me, it is probably a Twidere integration issue :) So when Twitter sends you an email about people favouriting and following or whatever, the email has a link in it. So I open the Gmail app to read the mail and occasionally want to go to the user profile for example. Even if I ask my Android 5 to open such a link with Twidere, it will open my default browser (which happens to be Opera), and the URL will change from https://mobile.twitter.com/… to something starting with twitter:// which in turn can, I guess, only be understood by the official Twitter app. So multiple issues/questions here: why doesn't or cannot Twidere get associated with the link in the first place? can Twidere learn to hook onto twitter:// "protocol" and do the right thing? (why on Earth is Twitter such an a-hole about third party clients?)

report.summary: Can't view profile of RT'd user in a "tweets of user" tab
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've got a tab showing all tweets of a specific user. Whenever I want to visit the profile of any other user who's been retweeted into this timeline by tapping on that other user's avatar, I get this screen, loading forever: This problem does persist even when navigating through the thread of the retweeted tweet, tapping tweets and then the avatar... it persists through the whole possible action tree starting at the tab showing the tweets of a specific user (as far as I tested). Steps to reproduce: Add a tab "tweets of specific user" (e.g. "@kiforbiter", which is a retweet bot) Pick any retweet in that tab and try to visit the retweeted user's profile. Actual behavior: I see the screen above. Expected behaviour: I see the retweeted user's profile. In tabs of a different type, everything's working fine. Using Twidere 3.2.9 on Nexus 5/Android 5.1.1.

report.description: It's a sort of crash, but the app does not close. Expected behavior When viewing a tweet with more replies than fit on the screen, you swipe down to read the replies. When you reach the last reply, you can not swipe down further. To return to your timeline, you can use the Android Back button. Actual behavior When viewing a tweet met more replies than fit on the screen and you swipe down to the last reply, the screen flashes white and you are returned to the timeline. It's virtually impossible to read the last reply, because the moment you arrive at the last reply, the screen flashes white and you are returned to the timeline. Steps to reproduce Find a tweet with a good number of replies in your timeline. Tap the tweet. Swipe down to the last reply. Extra info n/a Android version: (version code here) Android 7.0 (OxygenOS 4.0.3 on OnePlus 3T) Network type: Cellular Wi-Fi App version: (version code here) Twidere V 3.4.31 Build variant: Google F-Droid Micro-blogging service: Twitter Fanfou GNU Social / StatusNet App settings: Custom API Custom consumer key/secrets Official keys Using Thumbor Connected through proxy Media preview enabled

report.summary: No Mastodon's toots in home
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, I'm using Twidere for my Twitter account and my Mastodon account, but I can't see the toots in the Home view. Expected behavior When adding my Mastodon account I was expecting one of those behaviours: Have the tweets and the toots mixed together in the home column Have a home view for tweets when my Twitter account is selected on the left, and have a home view for toots when my Mastodon account is selected on the left. Actual behavior I only see tweets in the Home view. Even when I switch accounts in the sidebar, it has no effect on the column view. I can't see toots of the Home column. Steps to reproduce Start Twidere with the Twitter account already opened (after the first start of the phone) to only be able to see tweets in the home column. Start Twidere with the Mastodon account already opened (after the first start of the phone) to only be able to see toots in the home column. Extra info I know the Mastodon account works because I can see the local toots in the Public Timeline and the Network Timeline. Okay, I just tried again and it seems I can see toots in the Home view when I open Twidere with the Mastodon account already selected (at the phone's first start). In this case it's this time the tweets which don't display in the Home view. My Twitter and Mastodon accounts are exactly the same name (@KillianKemps), maybe is it there a conflict. Android version: 5.1 Network type: Cellular Wi-Fi App version: 3.5.25 Build variant: Google F-Droid Micro-blogging service: Twitter Mastodon

report.summary: The new Beta version (3.5.37) can not use API consumer Key
report.label: None yet
report.description: 问题 Twidere 在 Google Play Beta 测试组推送的新版 (3.5.37) 在 OAuth 模式下不能使用官推的 consumer key，但 xAuth 下在应用内登录后 (不经过浏览器授权) 可以使用官推 API 操作步骤 在应用内先设置好自己的 API consumer key 和 secret 删除账号再登录 (选择 Twitter) 在点选应用的 Login 的按钮后打开的浏览器授权页面还是显示授权的是 Twidere for Twitter #5 而不是 Twitter for Android，登录后也是使用的 Twidere 的 API。 当我选择 xAuth 的模式后，删除账号重新登录 (弹出账号选择，不选择任何东西) 然后直接在应用内登录则使用的是 Twitter for Android 的 API 相关信息 系统: Android 5.0.2 (Sony sol26 ROM) Twidere 版本: 3.5.37 (Google Play Beta Version)

report.summary: Bundle Twemoji
report.label: None yet
report.description: Twitter develops their own set of Creative Commons-licensed emoji graphics: https://github.com/twitter/twemoji Unlike Android, where users are dependent on OEMs to ship updates for new Unicode versions, Twemoji is constantly being updated. They are also used by Twitter for their hashflags feature. For details see http://emojipedia.org/twitter/ Bundling Twemoji would give users a consistent Twitter experience across formfactors. It would also ensure that users don't get to see a placeholder, just because their phone is one year old.

report.summary: Detect the allowed file size for attachments in GNU social
report.label: None yet
report.description: In the API for the settings of the node (located at /api/statusnet/config.xml on every GNU social or Statusnet instance) there is an entry called file_quota. You can find it in the XML tree under config > attachments > file_quota and it shows the allowed file size in Bytes. I think it'd be nice if Twidere could read this value and warn the user if he is about to send a bigger attachment as allowed. The current behavior is that the post is submitted as normal, but the attachment is missing and the user notices this only afterwards. And I sometimes wondered why the image is missing although I intended to (and did) add one… 😉 Edit: Of course there is also JSON, e.g.: curl https://gnusocial.de/api/statusnet/config.json | jq .attachments.file_quota

report.summary: Favoriting a Notice Favorites the Wrong Notice
report.label: None yet
report.description: This weird phenomenon only occurs, to my knowledge, with one user in particular. I went through the profile of @donniethedumbass@quitter.im and favorited a few notices of his. Then I look at my own profile @gooz@shitposter.club to see that I've favorited notices I've never even seen before, some of which were in German or other languages I don't speak. But looking at my profile, there was no trace of the notes that I ACTUALLY favorited. I tried favoriting the same notes in AndStatus and through the web interface, both of which did the correct thing—favorited the right notices instead of these seemingly random ones. I don't know where to begin troubleshooting this. If there's any info you need me to gather, just ask. Expected behavior Favorite the note when I press the favorite button. Actual behavior In most cases, it behaves as expected, but for notes posted by @donniethedumbass@quitter.im and perhaps some others, rather than favoriting THAT note, a seemingly random otder note gets favorited. Steps to reproduce Be a GNUu Social user on shitposter.club (maybe not necessary) Find @donniethedumbass@shitposter.club Favorite one of his notes. report.summary: [Feature Request] RTs from one platform to another (Attachments)
report.label: None yet
report.description: When RTing from one platform to another (eg. from Twitter to GNU Social), Twidere will grab a link to the attachment where it is on the original platform. At least for some kinds of attachments, like images most importantly, I think it would be a good idea for Twidere to download the image(s) and upload them as attachments when tweeting to the destination platform, rather than just linking to the first one. Off the top of my head, this gives us two benefits. If the original tweet gets deleted or censored, the RT on GNU Social will still be intact. Users on GNU Social can view the attachments without sending traffic back to Twitter and perhaps being tracked when they don't want to be.

report.summary: Merge develop into master for fdroids updatecheck to work
report.label: None yet
report.description: I noticed that the last release, 3.6.24, is only available in the develop branch, it's not yet included in master. This is a problem because F-Droid's notion of current version depends on the latest available manifest versioncode in the master branch. This means even after the build was manually added for 3.6.24 the current version was reset by the build-bot to 3.6.23 on the next run. Can you merge develop into master before you make a new release? Or is 3.6.24 actually dev release (But I see no other indication of that)? (Normally fdroid checks for available tags in the git repo, but this doesn't work for twidere for reasons I've not completely understood. It always picks the wrong subfolder and ends up with some version 1.0)

report.label: None yet
report.description: I have a scenario where I have two accounts. There are some cases where there is still an overlap in who I follow. There are some cases where I don't want to remove this overlap. I am perfectly fine with seeing the same tweet/retweet twice, but currently there is no way of knowing which account the tweet is associated with. This causes an issue if I want to reply, like, or retweet. The current setup says that the first account that is logged in will come first, so I can partially get around this, but there is absolutely no distinction between a tweet that has no overlap (One of my accounts doesn't follow the tweeter). An example: Account Foo and Bar are my accounts. Foo and Bar have some overlapping accounts that they both follow. Foo follows these accounts: Ayy Bee See Bar follows these accounts: Dee Bee See Account "Ayy" submits a tweet. Account "Bee" submits a tweet. I want to retweet the tweet from Bee to my Bar account. My timeline now looks like this: --- Bee: This is a picture of my cat (Media) Reply, Retweet, Like --- --- Bee: This is a picture of my cat (Media) Reply, Retweet, Like --- --- Ayy: I like cats Reply, Retweet, Like --- There is no distinction in any of these tweets which account of mine it originates from. The only reason I know Ayy's tweet is from Foo is because Bar does not follow Ayy. It is entirely up to guessing and checking to figure out which of the tweets from Bee corresponds to account Bar. This makes it difficult to like, retweet, or reply.

report.summary: No option visit list's creator profile
report.label: None yet
report.description: When browsing a lists's page, for example, in the "BELONGS TO" page, we can not click on the list's creator profile picture to access his profile. De facto, there is no easy way to go to the list creator's profile, we have to look up for his name in the Search view. Expected behavior Clicking on the list creator's profile picture should take me to their profile AND / OR an option when displaying a list to go to the creator's profile (maybe under "Open with account" option ?) Actual behavior Clicking on the list creator's profile picture opens the list. I can not access rob's profile from here. An option "Go to list owner's profile" or something would be nice here under "Open with account" Steps to reproduce Go to the "Lists" page in the menu. Extra info App version: 3.7.3 Build variant: Google F-Droid Micro-blogging service: Twitter Fanfou GNU Social / StatusNet Mastodon App settings: Custom API Custom consumer key/secrets Official keys Using Thumbor Connected through proxy Media preview enabled
